Football!

‎09-07-2011 07:41 AM

Okay,
I LOVE FRIDAY night lights and High School football, and enjoy watching my 17 year old son play.  The last two Friday games have seemed to have increased my FBG.  The first game which was rather close all game long until the end...really seemed to elevate my BG all weekend.  I am quite vocal, emotional and loud at the games....You think it is a stress reaction?

Tonight we had a JV game..we will see what my FBG is going to be 

Thanks Rick

Diagnosed T2 4/4/2011
04/04/2011, A1c 11.2
06/27/2011, A1c 5.6
10/07/2011, A1c 5.7
1/14/2012, A1c 5.4
4/17/2012, A1c 5.4
7/27/2012, A1c 5.3
01/30/2013, A1c 5.2
08/26/2013, A1c 5.3
01/26/2014, A1c 5.5
07/25/2014, A1c 5.4

Lipids TC 203, LDL 110, VLDL 20, Triglycerides 100, HDL 73
Managed by diet and exercise along....former insulin and Metformin user

‎09-07-2011 08:05 AM

Could be, even if it is good stress.

You reminded me that on the parents board, parents have sometimes said that their child's blood glucose may drop during practice, but then go up during a real game.  It's something about adrenaline and insulin.

"Molly" (aka mollythed)
Type 2 diabetes diagnosed in 1995, now managed with Lantus, Novolog and Metformin; diet and exercise.
My late husband had diabetes. My three adult sons also have type 2 diabetes.

‎09-07-2011 04:21 PM

Thanks Molly,

Still have not got it figured out...My FBG was only 101 today...expected a little higher.

There was good  stress last night...My sons team won, and I watched him bulldoze between the tackles 8 yards for a touchdown, and then right after that he ran the ball in for a two point conversion.  There was some bad stress also...My son also got a facemask planted on his arm and elbow during a run earlier in the game.  I was concerned it was his shoulder from the way he was holding it, but the swelling is way down this morning...so that is good.

Just when I think I KNOW how my body is responding to this disease....it throws me a curve and another puzzle.
Thanks Rick

Diagnosed T2 4/4/2011
04/04/2011, A1c 11.2
06/27/2011, A1c 5.6

‎09-07-2011 08:44 PM

The guy who wrote the book "Think Like a Pancreas" addresses situations just like this.  He said "good" stress can affect BS and even things like thinking hard and studying can.  Taking a test can also, but that's in another "stress" catagory.

Lizzy
Knowledge is Power!

‎09-08-2011 03:28 AM

No useful advice here, I just wanted to say congratulations to your son for a great game!  I'm a football junkie {mostly college, but I go pro too}, but I just watched a couple really great high school games on ESPN over the weekend.  Football is exciting at all levels!

Give him a big pat on the back, it sounds like he really earned it! 
2000 mg Metformin ER 1x daily
10 mg Glipizide 1x daily
38 Units Lantus 1x daily

Thanks...I will let my son know that you congratulated him.  I am also a football fan at all levels....

Can you say MIZ....  ZOU!, and yes I AM a long suffering Chiefs fan 

I really do love this time of year...the summer heat is going...crisp fall nights and the snap of the ball, the crack of pads, and I really love to watch a perfectly executed play. 
Thanks Rick

‎09-08-2011 04:28 AM

I couldn't have said it better.  I love everything about Fall, especially football.  I always get depressed after the Superbowl.

This year I'm gonna be suffering all the way around.  I'm a Buckeye fan and a Marshall fan, and they're both gonna get whooped.  I like the Chiefs, too.  My stepdad lives in KS and is a big fan.

And it's funny that you mention this, cause after the Marshall/WVU game, I was worried about my bg going up.  And it did.  I guess I need to learn to watch sports more calmly, or skip a few grams of carbs before a game.  The latter would probably be the easier one. 
2000 mg Metformin ER 1x daily
10 mg Glipizide 1x daily
38 Units Lantus 1x daily
